issues.description: The template repository defines the farm class as `AnimalFarm` (in Farm.java), but the problem statement and solution refer to a class named `Farm`. Students will be unable to locate or instantiate the correct class, leading to compile errors and confusion.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the template class from `AnimalFarm` to `Farm` (and adjust the file name if necessary) so that it matches the problem statement and solution implementation.

issues.description: The `singFarmSongVerse` method in the template has no formal parameter (`private void singFarmSongVerse(/*Animal animal*/)`) but the problem statement and solution expect a signature of `singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal)`. This parameter mismatch will prevent students from implementing the intended behavior and matching the provided tests.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the template method signature to `private void singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal)` so it matches the specification and reference solution.

issues.description: The problem statement and solution refer to a class named `Farm`, but the template repository defines it as `AnimalFarm`, preventing students from mapping the required `Farm` class to the provided template.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the class `AnimalFarm` in the template repository to `Farm` so that it matches the problem statement and the solution implementation.
